item.title: Using my driveway and front lawn, 22nd July
item.description:
My next door neighbour keeps using my driveway and front lawn to drive across to park their car on their front lawn as they do not have a drop curb. It is causing damage to my front lawn, and they should not be using my driveway. There is plenty of parking, so there is absolutely no need for him to be parking there, and especially not using my driveway and front lawn to park.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Templefields, Andoversford, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sign needed to prevent large lorries from attempting to get down road, 21st July
item.description:
Large lorries from Mead rd industrial estate frequently try to go down Fairfield walk which is too narrow for them. They end up getting stuck and having to reverse back up the road which is causing obstructions on a regular basis. Also lorries having to reverse onto Naunton lane which is dangerous and has limited view and is also where many school children walk. Please add a sign at the start of Fairfield walk at the mead rd junction stating that it is not suitable for large lorries.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Naunton Lane, Leckhampton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 3 inch wide sinkhole emerged in pavement - at least 12 inches deep and edges are breaking away fast, increasing size of hole, 21st July
item.description:
The sinkhole is in the pavement right at the entrance to 72 Malleson Road ('Barefoot House'), toward the western side of the opening for the driveway. It appeared suddenly in the last week or so (not sure of exact date and, as noted above, the edges (since the ground underneath is completely absent) are breaking away - soon it may be large enough that a pedestrian could sink their foot into it, which would likely break their ankle (using a stick it seems to be about a foot deep)

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 72, Malleson Road, Gotherington, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: White lines barely visible on pavement around Westal Green, 21st July
item.description:
The white lines indicating the separation of cycles and pedestrians on the pavement between St Stephen’s Road and Hatherley Road is a potential safety issue, especially near the Westal Green crossing. This report is similar the the one I have just submitted but is at the other side of the dual carriageway.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hatherley Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
